alert.note: Alert for Daviess (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 5:09PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Knox and northern Daviess Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 508 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Linton, or 25 miles northeast of Vincennes, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Knox and northern Daviess Counties, including the following locations... Elnora, Odon, and Plainville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
